page.title: 14APPLETON WISKE VILLAGE HALL
page.content: Opened in 1974 and extended in 1980 is the centre for Badminton, Mothers and Toddlers and Playschool.On Tuesday mornings it is used as a doctor's surgery and on the afternoon it is used by the Senior Citizens for their "Tuesday Club" Evening activities are varied,their being Cubs, Brownies, Guides and the Youth Club.Tennis is played by young and old on the car park in the summer.Table tennis is played indoors during the winter The Yorkshire Countrywomen's Association and other Committees, Mini bus, Recreation, Village Hall meet regularly.Other activities are fund raising dances, discos, quizzes, actions, fashion shows, antique fairs, childrens parties and Concerts.There is rarely a day or evening when the hall is not in use. Emma Bell.
